qas.question: What did Julian try to restore to the empire?
What building did Julian want to rebuild?
After Julian's death, under to what type of religion did the empire return?

context: Constantine's nephew <a0_0>Julian<a0_0/> rejected the "Galilean madness" of his upbringing for an idiosyncratic synthesis of neo-Platonism, Stoic asceticism and universal solar cult. Julian became Augustus in <a1_0>361<a1_0/> and actively but vainly fostered a religious and cultural pluralism, attempting a restitution of <a2_0>non-Christian practices<a2_0/> and rights. He proposed the rebuilding of <a3_0>Jerusalem's temple<a3_0/> as an Imperial project and argued against the "irrational impieties" of Christian doctrine. His attempt to restore an Augustan form of principate, with himself as primus inter pares ended with his death in 363 in Persia, after which his reforms were reversed or abandoned. The empire once again fell under <a4_0>Christian control<a4_0/>, this time permanently.
